LOBL.content: hymen or alliance in the language of the other, strange vow by which we are committed in a language not our mother tongue > Derrida’s committed, are you? translators?
LOBL.linkedContent: hymen or alliance in the language of the other, strange vow by which we are committed in a language not our mother tongue > Derrida’s committed, are you? translators?

LOBL.content: vitrifying structure of writing & desire > hymen (as syllepsis) and pane of glass p. ~141 Blanchot: glass doesn’t use up what I enjoy, read book behind pane of glass
LOBL.linkedContent: vitrifying structure of writing & desire > hymen (as syllepsis) and pane of glass p. ~141 Blanchot: glass doesn’t use up what I enjoy, read book behind pane of glass

LOBL.content: commitment [wedding proposal] in irresponsibility of speech [Blanchot’s character proposes in Slavic not French], arrêt of commitment, commitment thus arrêté, both in one’s language & the other’s—the hymen > mother tongue does away w/ commitment & seals it
LOBL.linkedContent: commitment [wedding proposal] in irresponsibility of speech [Blanchot’s character proposes in Slavic not French], arrêt of commitment, commitment thus arrêté, both in one’s language & the other’s—the hymen > mother tongue does away w/ commitment & seals it

LOBL.content: I am “irresponsible” and absolutely committed in the establishment of the language of the other, which I do as if the first moment, the “at once” is the occasion of the hymen, its chance and its law
LOBL.linkedContent: I am “irresponsible” and absolutely committed in the establishment of the language of the other, which I do as if the first moment, the “at once” is the occasion of the hymen, its chance and its law

LOBL.content: [reference to la double séance] hymen s’arrête, comes about and is immediately forbidden, double-bind structure of event, its “madness”, every hymen intervenes like a crime, event, coup, its dissemination dissolves or absolves it in crowd by multiplying it incalculably
LOBL.linkedContent: [reference to la double séance] hymen s’arrête, comes about and is immediately forbidden, double-bind structure of event, its “madness”, every hymen intervenes like a crime, event, coup, its dissemination dissolves or absolves it in crowd by multiplying it incalculably

LOBL.content: essential irresponsibility of promise or response: crime of hymen  > repeats itself endlessly, takes place w/out taking place [writing/reading]
LOBL.linkedContent: essential irresponsibility of promise or response: crime of hymen > repeats itself endlessly, takes place w/out taking place [writing/reading]

LOBL.content: “come”: single word, yet intertwined in series, inscribes its own effacement in middle of and on invaginated boundaries of récit, of these crypts, death or bridal chambers, hymen brings alliance & separation [after theft of key]
LOBL.linkedContent: “come”: single word, yet intertwined in series, inscribes its own effacement in middle of and on invaginated boundaries of récit, of these crypts, death or bridal chambers, hymen brings alliance & separation [after theft of key]

LOBL.content: double hymen w/ each woman; each woman double, death mask, cast, ghost, body at once living & dead, of other > utterly other “in relation to” one another: each one is the other
LOBL.linkedContent: double hymen w/ each woman; each woman double, death mask, cast, ghost, body at once living & dead, of other > utterly other “in relation to” one another: each one is the other

LOBL.content: an “immediately” that weds symbiosis to synthanatosis (in a triumph w/out identity) [is the hymen not a fetish? The at once of disavowal? (See Glas 210)]
LOBL.linkedContent: an “immediately” that weds symbiosis to synthanatosis (in a triumph w/out identity) [is the hymen not a fetish? The at once of disavowal? (See Glas 210)]

LOBL.content: hymen, double bind, double affirmation, yes, yes, come, come [re: Blanchot’s 2 ghostly fiancées in L’arrêt de mort] signifies, desires, arrête life death, the life the death of the other, the other lives and dies > “for there is an other of the other and it is not the same” [see POO p. 11 “other of the other” is the very undeniable of ethics]
LOBL.linkedContent: hymen, double bind, double affirmation, yes, yes, come, come [re: Blanchot’s 2 ghostly fiancées in L’arrêt de mort] signifies, desires, arrête life death, the life the death of the other, the other lives and dies > “for there is an other of the other and it is not the same” [see POO p. 11 “other of the other” is the very undeniable of ethics]

LOBL.content: hymen is a “double bind” because each of these bonds that bind is [?], in itself, double
LOBL.linkedContent: hymen is a “double bind” because each of these bonds that bind is [?], in itself, double

LOBL.content: Miss Blind feminist objects to Derrida’s mad hypothesis re: hymen
LOBL.linkedContent: Miss Blind feminist objects to Derrida’s mad hypothesis re: hymen

LOBL.content: [re: Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort] 2 women, like doctor, sign his death warrant, but always as countersignature, because death “given” is requested, demanded, received it with/from/in the hand of the other > another hymen
LOBL.linkedContent: [re: Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort] 2 women, like doctor, sign his death warrant, but always as countersignature, because death “given” is requested, demanded, received it with/from/in the hand of the other > another hymen

LOBL.content: Derrida’s mad hypothesis, nothing to do w/ intention of “author” that the hymen btwn the 2 women in L’arrêt de mort (separated by uncrossable glass partition of 2 stories) is the absolute terror, that they love and approach each other w/out the narrator
LOBL.linkedContent: Derrida’s mad hypothesis, nothing to do w/ intention of “author” that the hymen btwn the 2 women in L’arrêt de mort (separated by uncrossable glass partition of 2 stories) is the absolute terror, that they love and approach each other w/out the narrator

LOBL.content: terrifying affirmation of one hymen guards the terror of another
LOBL.linkedContent: terrifying affirmation of one hymen guards the terror of another

LOBL.content: 2 women, 2 voices w/out voice, tele-phone each other: “come” > how do we read this unreadable hymen? it takes place as unreadable, from bottom of crypt in which it remains > it will have taken place where it remains: that’s the proof
LOBL.linkedContent: 2 women, 2 voices w/out voice, tele-phone each other: “come” > how do we read this unreadable hymen? it takes place as unreadable, from bottom of crypt in which it remains > it will have taken place where it remains: that’s the proof

LOBL.content: mad hypothesis overruns oppositional values that make rules and form the law in all the schools of reading, overruns delimitation of the fantasy as well
LOBL.linkedContent: mad hypothesis overruns oppositional values that make rules and form the law in all the schools of reading, overruns delimitation of the fantasy as well

LOBL.content: everything took place as if narrator desired that the 2 women resembled each other > in accordance w/ hymen (pas w/out him)
LOBL.linkedContent: everything took place as if narrator desired that the 2 women resembled each other > in accordance w/ hymen (pas w/out him)

AF.content: archive radically incompatible, heterogenous, in divorce w/ arkhē
AF.linkedContent: archive radically incompatible, heterogenous, in divorce w/ arkhē

HASD.content: the 2 traits of experience of prayer: 1) address to other as other (i.e. God), discourse, language, not predicative 2) economium or the celebration (hymnein, úμνéω)
HASD.linkedContent: the 2 traits of experience of prayer: 1) address to other as other (i.e. God), discourse, language, not predicative 2) economium or the celebration (hymnein, úμνéω)

MSUBJ.content: subjectile interposes itself as the hymen btwn inside & outside, finally becoming the jetée (the spurt, a spurt like a fallen stone, dead) > objective, subjective, projectile, introjection, objection, dejection, abjection
MSUBJ.linkedContent: subjectile interposes itself as the hymen btwn inside & outside, finally becoming the jetée (the spurt, a spurt like a fallen stone, dead) > objective, subjective, projectile, introjection, objection, dejection, abjection

MSUBJ.content: subjectile is the forceful throwing, casting and also what has to be traversed, pierced, the membrane, the paper > “the trajectory of what’s thrown upon it” dynamizes the skin in perforating it, passing to other side: “after having exploded the wall of the problem” [hymen]
MSUBJ.linkedContent: subjectile is the forceful throwing, casting and also what has to be traversed, pierced, the membrane, the paper > “the trajectory of what’s thrown upon it” dynamizes the skin in perforating it, passing to other side: “after having exploded the wall of the problem” [hymen]

BL.content: hymen of the law, its entry (Eintritt): ante portes (place of premature ejaculation), place & non-place: the adjournment ’til death of child is either premature ejaculation or non-ejaculation: no ejaculate w/out relation to the law [Lacan] > tabernacle empty, dissemination fatal
BL.linkedContent: hymen of the law, its entry (Eintritt): ante portes (place of premature ejaculation), place & non-place: the adjournment ’til death of child is either premature ejaculation or non-ejaculation: no ejaculate w/out relation to the law [Lacan] > tabernacle empty, dissemination fatal

MPM.content: if memory maneuvers btwn law and Being, can one think the being and law of memory? these questions move through transference & translation, above abyss; require impossible passageways: “the fragile resistance of a span” [hymen?]
MPM.linkedContent: if memory maneuvers btwn law and Being, can one think the being and law of memory? these questions move through transference & translation, above abyss; require impossible passageways: “the fragile resistance of a span” [hymen?]

A.content: pas [belongs to French?] involves the line that terminates all determination, peras (end, limit) not telos, puts us on path beyond, on other side, peraō eis khoran (penetrate into place, country)
A.linkedContent: pas [belongs to French?] involves the line that terminates all determination, peras (end, limit) not telos, puts us on path beyond, on other side, peraō eis khoran (penetrate into place, country)

T.content: ear-vulva, hymen, vesta, vestibule, hearth, familial

SH.content: the other is wed in the secrecy of the encounter (w/ another date)
SH.linkedContent: the other is wed in the secrecy of the encounter (w/ another date)

SP.content: hymen’s graphic, that of the pharmakon, inscribes castration’s effects w/in itself, w/out being reduced to it
SP.linkedContent: hymen’s graphic, that of the pharmakon, inscribes castration’s effects w/in itself, w/out being reduced to it

SP.content: regular, rhythmic blindness takes place in Nietzsche’s text, he’s lost there too > il y a de la perte, dès qu’il y a hymen
SP.linkedContent: regular, rhythmic blindness takes place in Nietzsche’s text, he’s lost there too > il y a de la perte, dès qu’il y a hymen

SP.content: Nietzsche’s analysis of sexual difference, “eternal war btwn sexes,” based on propriation, where woman takes shape acc. formalized law > woman is woman because she gives herself to a man who takes possession, or la femme en se donnant se donne-pour, simule et s’assure ainsi la mâtrise possessive: if opposition give/take, possess/possessed, is a “transcendental snare” produced by hymen’s graphics, process of propriation would escape dialectics and ontological decidability
SP.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s analysis of sexual difference, “eternal war btwn sexes,” based on propriation, where woman takes shape acc. formalized law > woman is woman because she gives herself to a man who takes possession, or la femme en se donnant se donne-pour, simule et s’assure ainsi la mâtrise possessive: if opposition give/take, possess/possessed, is a “transcendental snare” produced by hymen’s graphics, process of propriation would escape dialectics and ontological decidability

OTO.content: cannot think nor hear Nietzsche’s name w/out reaffirmation of the hymen, alliance or wedding ring, eternal return
OTO.linkedContent: cannot think nor hear Nietzsche’s name w/out reaffirmation of the hymen, alliance or wedding ring, eternal return

OTO.content: for Nietzsche, culture (Bildung) begins when we know how to treat the living as living; Derrida discusses a pact, alliance, contract, a hymen w/ living language, w/ mother (tongue), against death (father): even good master of history (science of the father) trains for the sake of mother tongue, must know when to suppress ‘historical interest’ for culture to begin
OTO.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, culture (Bildung) begins when we know how to treat the living as living; Derrida discusses a pact, alliance, contract, a hymen w/ living language, w/ mother (tongue), against death (father): even good master of history (science of the father) trains for the sake of mother tongue, must know when to suppress ‘historical interest’ for culture to begin

O.content: [general economy of hymen]: cette consumation [consumption, consummation], comme celle de l’hymen, ne commence ni ne finit jamais, en quoi son identité se dé-pense
O.linkedContent: [general economy of hymen]: cette consumation [consumption, consummation], comme celle de l’hymen, ne commence ni ne finit jamais, en quoi son identité se dé-pense

O.content: is pleasure literary in essence? if Vorlust, foreplay, prime (bonus) of seduction, formal moment of literature, ne se comble qu’à la fin du plaisir, then jouissance would be instance of seduction, prime supplémentaire de rien d’autre: pleasure a formal, threshold phenomena, nul et sans fins, a repression lifted & maintained > graphics of hymen questions all couples, all oppositions (especially those of Freud)
O.linkedContent: is pleasure literary in essence? if Vorlust, foreplay, prime (bonus) of seduction, formal moment of literature, ne se comble qu’à la fin du plaisir, then jouissance would be instance of seduction, prime supplémentaire de rien d’autre: pleasure a formal, threshold phenomena, nul et sans fins, a repression lifted & maintained > graphics of hymen questions all couples, all oppositions (especially those of Freud)

TB.content: for Derrida, “translation contract” is hymen or marriage contract (a seminar) > w/ promise to produce a child whose seed will give rise to history/growth
TB.linkedContent: for Derrida, “translation contract” is hymen or marriage contract (a seminar) > w/ promise to produce a child whose seed will give rise to history/growth

TB.content: Benjamin says as much, that in translation the original will enlarge itself > Derrida adds: this child can speak on its own, something other than a product subjected to law of reproduction > sacred and being-to-be-translated produce each other at edge of same limit
TB.linkedContent: Benjamin says as much, that in translation the original will enlarge itself > Derrida adds: this child can speak on its own, something other than a product subjected to law of reproduction > sacred and being-to-be-translated produce each other at edge of same limit

TB.content: promise of reconciliation (even if unfulfillable) is a rare & notable event: kingdom is never reached, is untouchable > but the commitment takes place, bequeaths its record
TB.linkedContent: promise of reconciliation (even if unfulfillable) is a rare & notable event: kingdom is never reached, is untouchable > but the commitment takes place, bequeaths its record

TB.content: Benjamin’s untouchable (unberührbar) reminds Derrida of the hymen, of the wedding gown more visibly
TB.linkedContent: Benjamin’s untouchable (unberührbar) reminds Derrida of the hymen, of the wedding gown more visibly

TB.content: untouchable: fascinates, orients work of translator

text will be even more virgin, intact, after passage of translation: hymen, sign of virginity, more jealous of itself after the other hymen, the contract signed, marriage consummated (untouchable remnant remains intact)
TB.linkedContent: text will be even more virgin, intact, after passage of translation: hymen, sign of virginity, more jealous of itself after the other hymen, the contract signed, marriage consummated (untouchable remnant remains intact)

REST.content: thing still hidden away, wrapped up underneath in its investiture (hypokeimenon, subjectum: both still hide or veil)
REST.linkedContent: thing still hidden away, wrapped up underneath in its investiture (hypokeimenon, subjectum: both still hide or veil)

REST.content: the hiding or veiling, figure of the veil, is drawn into undecidability by the hymen
REST.linkedContent: the hiding or veiling, figure of the veil, is drawn into undecidability by the hymen

REST.content: Heidegger’s Verlässlichkeit (reliability, solidity), [what Heidegger restitutes from Van Gogh’s painting?], anterior to opposition useful/sacred, comes from earth/world, from trait, the Ring required for a hymen per fidem, makes commitment possible, fidelity that predates everything
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Verlässlichkeit (reliability, solidity), [what Heidegger restitutes from Van Gogh’s painting?], anterior to opposition useful/sacred, comes from earth/world, from trait, the Ring required for a hymen per fidem, makes commitment possible, fidelity that predates everything

D.content: Mallarmé: mime sets up pure medium of fiction, perpetual allusion (in a hymen)
D.linkedContent: Mallarmé: mime sets up pure medium of fiction, perpetual allusion (in a hymen)

D.content: like the crime, consumption/consummation of fire never takes place—this is what the hymen names: 1) penetration, act perpetrated by what enters, consumes, sows confusion btwn partners 2) virginal screen that stands btwn desire/consummation, perpenetration/remembrance
D.linkedContent: like the crime, consumption/consummation of fire never takes place—this is what the hymen names: 1) penetration, act perpetrated by what enters, consumes, sows confusion btwn partners 2) virginal screen that stands btwn desire/consummation, perpenetration/remembrance

HST.content: limit (of forgiveness) cannot be crossed (infranchissable)—and is crossed insofar as it can’t be [hymen] > ultimate compassion, very test of substitution (impossible), to be hostage and hôte of the other
HST.linkedContent: limit (of forgiveness) cannot be crossed (infranchissable)—and is crossed insofar as it can’t be [hymen] > ultimate compassion, very test of substitution (impossible), to be hostage and hôte of the other

TN.content: logic of limit [hymen?]: what lets itself be touched does so on its edge (sur son bord), thus it doesn’t let itself be touched/reached (ne se laisse pas atteindre)—exposing untouchable itself, the other edge of the edge (l’autre bord du bord)
TN.linkedContent: logic of limit [hymen?]: what lets itself be touched does so on its edge (sur son bord), thus it doesn’t let itself be touched/reached (ne se laisse pas atteindre)—exposing untouchable itself, the other edge of the edge (l’autre bord du bord)

TN.content: one would also have to integrate the rhetoric, plus qu’une rhétorique quand elle franchit à chaque figure the limits btwn sensible/intelligible—finding itself on both sides of the limit
TN.linkedContent: one would also have to integrate the rhetoric, plus qu’une rhétorique quand elle franchit à chaque figure the limits btwn sensible/intelligible—finding itself on both sides of the limit

LG.content: Derrida includes very elusive, allusive reference to hymen [genre as gender], rapport sans rapport btwn masculine & feminine; genre (Gattung) and marriage in series gattieren, gatten, Gatte/Gattin
LG.linkedContent: Derrida includes very elusive, allusive reference to hymen [genre as gender], rapport sans rapport btwn masculine & feminine; genre (Gattung) and marriage in series gattieren, gatten, Gatte/Gattin

LG.content: [Blanchot’s] immense double affirmation both to life & death, forming an alliance or marriage bond w/ itself (“hymen”)
LG.linkedContent: [Blanchot’s] immense double affirmation both to life & death, forming an alliance or marriage bond w/ itself (“hymen”)

LG.content: [vis-à-vis Blanchot] as long as I say “yes, yes,” I’m a woman and beautiful, man rendered other: secret and odd hymen > madness of sexual difference, mixing of genres
LG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Blanchot] as long as I say “yes, yes,” I’m a woman and beautiful, man rendered other: secret and odd hymen > madness of sexual difference, mixing of genres

LG.content: transsexuality permits me, in a more than metaphorical & transferential way, to engender
LG.linkedContent: transsexuality permits me, in a more than metaphorical & transferential way, to engender

SPEC.content: curtain (rideau): canvases, veils, hymens, umbrellas > Derrida neither has time nor taste (goût) to show how they accord to same law (accomplished by itself or done w/out)
SPEC.linkedContent: curtain (rideau): canvases, veils, hymens, umbrellas > Derrida neither has time nor taste (goût) to show how they accord to same law (accomplished by itself or done w/out)

SPEC.content: curtains, veils, “skirt” of bed, hymen of fort:da, edge of bed (lit) [of reading?], va-et-vient, there would’ve been a hymen even w/out curtains > veil of this “skirt” is interest of bed (lit) and fort:da of all these generations
SPEC.linkedContent: curtains, veils, “skirt” of bed, hymen of fort:da, edge of bed (lit) [of reading?], va-et-vient, there would’ve been a hymen even w/out curtains > veil of this “skirt” is interest of bed (lit) and fort:da of all these generations

SPEC.content: [Derrida clearly explains the difference btwn fort/da and fort:da] “skirt” of bed, which hides the bars, forms inner chamber of fort/da, double screen which divides w/in itself—but dividing only by reassembling it w/ itself, sticking (piquant) to itself doubly, fort:da
SPEC.linkedContent: [Derrida clearly explains the difference btwn fort/da and fort:da] “skirt” of bed, which hides the bars, forms inner chamber of fort/da, double screen which divides w/in itself—but dividing only by reassembling it w/ itself, sticking (piquant) to itself doubly, fort:da

SPEC.content: PP btwn 2 limits of the w/out pleasure: stricture & discharge, preparation & end, desire & final fulfillment: liminary place of passage (hymen indécis pris dans l’anneau), le passage du pas: pleasure arrives only to erase itself
SPEC.linkedContent: PP btwn 2 limits of the w/out pleasure: stricture & discharge, preparation & end, desire & final fulfillment: liminary place of passage (hymen indécis pris dans l’anneau), le passage du pas: pleasure arrives only to erase itself

CHOR.content: hymen: 1) membranous fold 2) marriage > lies btwn inside/outside of woman, btwn desire & its fulfillment: once pierced there is no hymen
CHOR.linkedContent: hymen: 1) membranous fold 2) marriage > lies btwn inside/outside of woman, btwn desire & its fulfillment: once pierced there is no hymen

CHOR.content: “hymen,” “invagination,” part of Derrida’s attempt to re-sexualize philosophical/theoretical discourse, but these terms no longer simply designate figures of feminine body: what remains undecidable concerns [but not only] line of cleavage btwn 2 sexes
CHOR.linkedContent: “hymen,” “invagination,” part of Derrida’s attempt to re-sexualize philosophical/theoretical discourse, but these terms no longer simply designate figures of feminine body: what remains undecidable concerns [but not only] line of cleavage btwn 2 sexes

CHOR.content: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)
CHOR.linkedContent: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)

CHOR.content: questions of representation [of women] always too old & as yet to be born, overloaded w/ hieroglyphs & still as virgin as origin, like early morning in East
CHOR.linkedContent: questions of representation [of women] always too old & as yet to be born, overloaded w/ hieroglyphs & still as virgin as origin, like early morning in East
